alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA, SOUTHEASTERN MCKINLEY AND SOUTHWESTERN SANDOVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marquez, or 22 miles north of Laguna Pueblo, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marquez. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains
